title: 112_hr1343
content:
ACCOUNTABILITY FOR BROADBAND STIMULUS FUNDS. The Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service or the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information can terminate awards under the Broadband Initiatives Program or the Broadband Technology Opportunities Program for reasons like poor performance, wasteful or fraudulent spending. Upon termination, funds equivalent to the award, less allowable costs, must be returned to the Treasury. Upon termination of awards under the Broadband Initiatives Program or the Broadband Technology Opportunities Program, any recovered additional amounts must be deobligated immediately. The Administrator or Assistant Secretary must return deobligated amounts to the Treasury within 30 days. No expenditures are allowed during the termination process. The Administrator or Assistant Secretary must take corrective measures to prevent funds from being spent after terminating an award. The recipient of a terminated award must provide a complete and accurate accounting of any unspent funds. SEC. 2. DISPOSITION OF UNUSED FUNDS.

The Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service or the Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Communications and Information must return any unused award funds, minus allowable costs, to the Treasury if the award is returned or disclaimed after the enactment of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009.

SEC. 3. OVERSIGHT AND REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. If officials report noncompliance or improper fund usage in broadband programs under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009, the Administrator or Assistant Secretary must review the information promptly and decide within 30 days whether to terminate the award. The Administrator or Assistant Secretary must review reports of noncompliance in broadband programs and decide within 30 days whether to terminate the award. Officials described include Inspectors General and the Comptroller General. Congressional notification is required within 3 days of making a determination. The notification required by officials must include an explanation of the determination made regarding noncompliance in broadband programs and any resulting actions taken. Confidential notification may be required in certain circumstances. If the Administrator or Assistant Secretary determines that there is no merit to information causing noncompliance in broadband programs and public notification would cause harm, they may make a confidential congressional notification. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 6001(i)(4) of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 is amended to change "may" to "shall" and remove the provision for competitive awarding of funds. SEC. 5. AWARD DEFINED. The term "award" in this Act includes grants and loans.
